Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2012 11:45AM missy21 wrote: Thank you ladies.  I put a call into my clinic...waiting to hear from them.
Posts.Title: Lump in armpit...strong family history missy21 Rocket

Posts.Content: missy21 wrote: I just turned 39. I am followed very closely at a breast center (yearly) with mammograms and MRI's because of my family history.  My sister was diagnosed with DCIS at 38, she chose a double mastectomy. My mother was diagnosed in her early 50's with DCIS (lumpectomy was only treatment she wanted) and then 6 month follow up mammo showed possible spreading of cancer.  Hard to explain but she chose no treatment and passed away 4 years later from mets to liver.   I also have an aunt on my fathers side that had breast cancer and she needed a mastectomy. No further info on her, but she is doing well. Now me:  I noticed some uncomfortableness (is that a word??) under my left armpit for the past couple of weeks.  Tonight I felt a mobile lump, about the size of an almond on the bottom half of my armpit.  It's not painful.  It feels pretty smooth.  I don't have my yearly visit with the breast center until next month.  Is this typical of cancer?  Fibroadenoma?  I have had several biopsies, all fibroadenomas.  Can cancer resemble a fibroadenoma?  Any info would be greatly appreciated.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lump in armpit...strong family history missy21 Rocket

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2012 08:48PM - edited Sep 23, 2012 08:48PM by missy21 Yes.discomfort is the word I was looking for.  I was just trying to decide if I should wait until my appointment at the end of October, or should I make a call tomorrow and see if I can get in sooner.  Since I have had so many needle biopsies and am full of lumps...I tend to not get too shaken when I feel something.  I know there was a lymph node they said was enlarged and were watching...but as of a year ago, no changes were seen.  I don't know which side that was on.  I have not been keeping up with self exams as my 2 year old son passed away 10 months ago and I have been dealing with that.  Thanks...I will call tomorrow and get their advice.
Posts.Title: Lump in armpit...strong family history missy21 Rocket

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2012 01:25PM missy21 wrote: UW Breast Center (in Madison,WI) is awesome!  Got me in this wednesday for appt with doc and all imaging needed to follow that appointment.  I need to remember to make sure to take care of myself...and leave NO lump unchecked!
